values: i now officially live on a boat, and i'd like to strangle the bastard who decided that this boat should be on an island right outside of san diego.  im hopelessly lost and it costs about half a million dollars to get anywhere from here. the cool part is that i got the top bunk, so whenever i sit up i dont smash my head on what would be the ass of the guy sleeping above me. on november twenty ninth im going out into the ocean for a few days to put weapons of mass destruction or someshit on this big ass grey metal thing i float around on, and then around january im going to another place right outside of somewhere cool. bremerton, washington. seattle is like 20 minutes away. dear god, someone send me email or something i can hardly get service on my phone and all the people i used to know in san diego are gone now.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/7352.html

theres a girl in my dream who i know in real life. she's my protector, she makes sure im safe. she's in the books i read and the sounds i hear. i always forget to call her because i cant separate asleep from awake.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/6914.html

maybe all the thoughts i think someone else had thought before i did, and all the words i speak pressed against the cheek and out anothers lips; but love is hard sir. we've both seen better days, we didnt have to look around and our lungs remembered to breathe. we could lay in bed and get comfortable enough to sleep.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/6657.html

the point of what im saying is characteristically unsatisfying, but those are our words. i made them for us. not sure what i want, but are you. not what you want, but sure of what i want. everything was together but i lost it because my toungue doesnt work. something about contention.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/6625.html

i live in california now, i'd bitch but the weathers nice and i found a record store the second day i was here. i met a man i named la tortuga, he told me that he was trying to get to san diego and i told him he was alredy there, then he pulled his jacket over his head and zipped it up, like a turtle in a shell, and continued the conversation in that manner.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/6253.html
fuck hurricane ivan, fuck this base, fuck being lied to.  i'd explain but i dont expect anyone to give two fucks or understand.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/5897.html

im in florida now. im  starting to like the idea of moving around and seeing so many different  things, but as much as everything changes, everything stays the same.  I talk to  so many different people and have the same fucking conversations.  Thats what i miss about being settled in one place, you get to know everything.  I get used to something and when it changes i start to miss it.  i even miss the things i hated about where i was.  
the base here in florida is nice, theres a lot of things to do and a lot of money to be blown on things i dont need.  Its not that im totally unrestricted, its just the comparison to great lakes that makes me feel so much more comfortable here.  im starting to wish i could stay longer, but then i remember that after this is over i get to come home.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/5656.html

Chicago is beautiful, the sky was this amazing blue-grey and the buildings disappeared into the clouds.  I went shopping on the miracle mile, and listened to people so rich that they talked about things i couldnt understand.  Of couse i had to stop at the Navy pier, which is this huge disgusting tourist trap, but aside from that it was nice.  While i was there two japanese tourists came and had me take a picture with them, i guess because i was in uniform and its the "navy" pier.  It really has nothing to do with the military anymore.  i got my picture with them as well, because japanese tourists should be a tourist attraction.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/5604.html

so im done with boot camp.  at first it was prison but now its a fucking joke.  anything that i can finish probably was never hard in the first place.  the only real hard part is missing all the people that mean so much to me, but im not dead so ya'll have to keep in touch.  i'll be home in about four weeks so leave me a number for you so we can drink a couple beers. LIANA!!! LET ME KNOW WHERE YOU ARE!
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/5280.html

Everyone tells me everything is going to work out, and it will, just not the way i want it to.  all these memories are going to be summarized, boxed, and put into storage.  Theres no room to remember how things felt. Those i love know i love them, even if ive never told them. I'm sorry for throwing so much away.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/4892.html

robert moved to mansfield after a five year prison sentence, he's off probation and trying hard to start a new life. He works with me at mcdonalds; i asked him about the tattoos on his hand.

" I did those when i was in tarrant county, i just got out of prison down in huntsville; in there Five years for burgulary of a building.  i guess the trick to being in jail so much is keeping to yourself.  Dont mind anyone elses business, and only worry when someone else is minding yours.  i got checked a couple times when i first got in, but i checked right back and no one really fucked with me after that.  you'll get the most shit from little guys who like to run thier mouth."

he takes off his sweat soaked hat and uses the bill to scratch his head.  i asked him if hes able to get by on working the hours they're giving him.

" shit, if it was just me it wouldnt be a problem. i've got two kids mouths to feed.  i fucked up when i was young and now ive been married for eleven years.  I wish i had done something, joined the army, something. i dont want to be responsible for no one elses life."

robert never raises his voice.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/4817.html

Bobby was 43 and came to live with his auntie in oak cliff. I think he said he was originally from california. He asked me for a dollar and i asked him for a story.

" i ain't tryin' to tell nobody no stories, i dont like to lie, i just tell the truth; people tend to help you out a whole lot more when ya tell the truth. When i was back home i was askin this man for a dollar, i told him i needed the money to get me home, but this man looked at me right in the eyes and told me i was lyin'. I just right and told the truth, i told him that i wanted to get me a beer and that man pulled out his wallet and gave me a twenty dollar bill. he said for me to buy as much beer as i could drink. ever since then i always try and tell the truth"

Bobby was so convincing he could join the clergy.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/4425.html

i just watched white guy explain to a black guy and a mexican...

why interracial marriage is wrong.
why black and mexican people would be nothing without white people.
why the things white people invented were more important that the things blacks and mexicans invented.
And, why white people are smarter than them both.

i watched thier faces while they nodded, understanding that if they told the white guy how full of shit he was they would lose thier jobs.  this was two seventeen year old kids with futures being talked down to by a thirty year old man in a dead end job, and the man was speaking in ebonics while he was doing it. 

i watched all this and i didnt say or do anything because i could lose my job too, how fucking pathetic is that.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/4318.html

there really is a huge gaping hole in my life because i dont have a florist i use regularly. i'm sure that everyone has this problem, and i'm sure that everyone is trying thier hardest to fix it. what i think i should do, is go around killing all of my friends so i can send flowers to thier funeral. i guess i could just piss them off and send flowers but that doesnt involve cannibalism.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/3863.html

i drove out to lee's future life yesterday.  Im really excited for him, it even made me sorta want to go to college.  i changed my mind as soon as i got back home though.  Denton seems like a good place for him to be for a while, but i think he'll end up in california eventually.
i got a new computer. its fast as shit. Its really too bad i wont be able to use it for very long.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/3689.html

I'd like things to be simple. Words are cluttered interpretations of feelings, they never fit whats in my head. I don't care about society or politics, all that matters is my direct interaction with the people around me.  Groups are only interesting if you watch one person and wonder what they are thinking about. My future doesnt intrest me me as much as everyone elses does.  I know i worry too much about everything, and im sure that no one notices everything i think they do.  Are all the things people do Intentional?
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/3448.html
i'm going clean. Quitting smoking is going to be the hardest, mostly because i dont want to. I have a hundred days left before i leave and a lot of loose ends to tie up.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/3229.html

When i turned onto my street there was this guy on a bicycle; He was stopped right in the middle of the road so i couldnt pass him.  We were staring at eachother for a long time but neither one of us moved. he was wearing one of those orange vests with reflective strips.  After about a minute of staring, he pulls out a camera and takes a picture of me.  Then he just rode off.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/2882.html

Theres nothing to update about, except that im tired of being young, and not looking forward to getting older.

cars exhaled exhaust.
legs crossed flicking cigarettes into the road.
and all these words mean nothing,
and all this time means nothing,
but the space between us.
the space that used to be between us.
theres no change but the length of a stare, 
the touch of a hand,
and the loss of a heart.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/2669.html

And we found out that youre a chameleon. You change with everyone.  How can you be eighteen years old and not know what it feels like to be alone.  He doesn't fit in your pattern.  We both want something that doesnt exist anymore.


Ive been working for two weeks without a day off, im loving every minute of it.  I dont have time to bullshit around.  Im too busy to think.  Now im in school, the only place i dont have anything to do.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/2525.html

This weekend is blurry. It had valentines day in it, so its good that its blurry. I'm convinced the whole thing was one big friday night.  Lee came and got me from work with a girl named allie.  We crashed at her sisters place that night.  The snow was beautiful, and because we were drunk it was more beautiful.  The neighborhood has a million trees and they were all coated with snow.  
   I spent the early part of valentines day with Jonathan.  I've never seen Him so broken up; Usually he collects all my pieces and puts them back together with me, now i should be helping him but i can't help myself. I hope its not forever this time, but nothing seems to be changing.
   Some really dumb really giggly girls picked me and sean up from his place.  Jonathan stayed.  They drank while they drove, and they drove too fast. we went to a party with people i hate but the beer was free so i didnt complain.  liana was there and so was brandon.  Good to see them.  Lee and sean (rauh) showed up, sow e went back to my place and watched a movie. 
   After work sunday i finally washed my car.  Paige got me some pizza, and now i am forever grateful to her.  Then we went to seans, got trashed, went to jessi's, came home, and everyone passed out.  I stayed up and watched the royal tennenbaums again.  
   The sleep i got sunday was the best sleep ive had in a few months.  i didnt want to wake up.  It should have been monday morning forever.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/2186.html

Jaime and Corey's show went great.  Everybody from everywhere came out, and im pretty sure they made a decent amount of money.  I talked to a lot of people i hadn't seen in a while, and some i see all the time but dont usually talk to.  Its always cool going out with jonathan and sean.  Then it was the next day, and i was an hour late to work. No one noticed.  I came running in, out of breath and unshaven, and apologized for being so late. my boss just looked at me, nodded her head, and said it was alright. That was the second time i've been late in 7 months.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/1971.html

Yeah, so i watched house of the dead lastnight. They broke a bunch of zombie rules. There was some dismemberment and gore though, even a few head explosions. then i went and drove around with my lights off. went to bed early.
   I've been working at mcdonalds for seven months now. I guess its good that i havent noticed it being that long. i got my six months pin a few days back, which means ive been working there longer than half the people employed. including my bosses.  i was really fucking excited about getting it, working gives me a purpose. I know its a fucking job at mcdonalds but im important there so its important to me.
the bell is going to ring, more later.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/1669.html

Yeah, so i talked to the girl today. 
If you know me you know who i'm talking about.
It didnt go so well.
So I got so fucked up i couldn't walk.
I didnt forget shit.
I accept who i am and what i will be.
Now it's just learning to let go of everything before i can find anything.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/1402.html

Yeah, so im in second period right now.  
  I had a dream last night that i lost all my teeth.  I bit down and felt something crack, so i ran to the mirror and looked.  There was a crack running right near my gums with a little blood running out.  When i finally opened my mouth my teeth fell out all over the bathroom counter.  All that was left were the roots, and it hurt like hell if they touched anything so i couldn't close my mouth.  I woke up early and ate    breakfast. Fuck having no teeth. 
  I also watched waking life last night. Thanks paige. I spent a lot of time admiring the art but i was also trying to pay attention the movie in its whole.  I think i'll watch it once with no volume. And im sure as hell buying the soundtrack.  Its not the kind of movie that you cant sleep after, but it was damn good.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/1179.html

Back to routine today.
 
 Back to work.
 Back to school.
 Back to not getting any sleep.
           
Lame.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/895.html

This weekend.  
Got off work friday around eight. Picked up lee and paige.  Went to waffle house.  The law of conservation of Mass.  Past Relationships.  Law of Thermodynamics.  Ghosts. Went to Mansfield for no reason. Nothing happened. Went home. Watched Forest Gump. Went to sleep at three.

Saturday I woke up at seven thirty.  Worked out.  Ran a couple miles. Got new tires.  Met the ladies at the mall. We came back to my house.  Bullshitted. Went to Johns. Bought some Bud Light.  Got really stoned off contact.  Drove around.  Talked like mexicans.  Ate pizza. Laughed A lot.

Got to Dylan and Shea's place around Ten.  Drunk by eleven.  Stumbled around.  Talked to old friends.  Met a girl named Jayme.  Bullshitted.  Smoked too much.  Bummed out too many.  Sent lee and sean after more cigarettes. Talked to Misty. We ended up together by the end of the night.  Justin snores. And sort of stole my car.  And told me he threw my shoe out the Window.  Never fell asleep, but had a hangover.  Rested my head on a piece of wood for four hours.

Im not sure how the fuck any of that happened.  But i guess it was a nice change. Two days off in a row.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/642.html

im tired of sitting at the computer and typing into a word processor.  not that anything that i have to say is worth listening to, just the whole idea that if someone really wanted to listen they could makes me feel better. i didn't work today but i ended up there anyways, the only place that feels more comfortable is the car, but its dirty as shit and smells awful. So work it was, all the people there make me happy.  Went to the mall with the boys, bullshitted around and saw brittany. She leaves for alabama tomorrow.  i dont think its the best thing she could do, but its better that what she was doing here.  Goodluck. We'll miss you.
http://tracheotomy.livejournal.com/483.html
